results.title: Never cry wolf
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Lewis Allen, Jack Couffer, Joseph Strick and Carroll Ballard
results.brief_description: In the Arctic region wolves are suspected of contributing to the diminishing number of caribou herds. “The Lupine project” is established by the government to investigate and observe wolves to provide concrete evidence of their aggressive nature. A young biologist, Tyler (Charles Martin Tyler), is left alone in the unfriendly Arctic wilderness to conduct such a study where he must contend with the forces of nature to discover as much as he can about the canis lupis; the wolf. Based on Farley Mowat’s autobiographical novel of the same name, screenplay by Curtis Hanson. Also starring Brian Dennehy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Walt Disney Productions, Lewis Allen, Jack Couffer, Joseph Strick and Carroll Ballard

results.title: Never been kissed [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Bushwood Pictures, Flower Films, Fox 2000 Pictures, Sandy Isaac, Nancy Juvonen and Raja Gosnell
results.brief_description: In this romantic comedy Drew Barrymore plays Josie Geller, a nerdy self conscious (and at times self-loathing) twenty-five year old who harbours dreams of being swept off her feet by a prince, and falling in love for keeps. In reality she is perennially single and works for a newspaper as a copy editor whilst fostering ambitions to be a reporter. Part of Josie’s dream is realised when she is sent on an undercover assignment - back to high school. Unfortunately for Josie this means a return to the lion’s den - throughout her adolescence Josie was mocked mercilessly and once undercover she soon finds herself drawn back into the nerdy circles in which she is most comfortable. But when her editor demands that she joins the cool group Josie must transform herself or lose the assignment. Much of the humour in this film is quite black - the flashbacks (as well as those scenes in the present) when Josie is humiliated, are quite excruciating to watch. But the many sly intentions of the script are undermined by saccharine overtones that swamp the film. Barrymore however displays a deft talent for comedy, essentially carrying the film, playing a very sympathetic and quite believable teen and young adult.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bushwood Pictures, Flower Films, Fox 2000 Pictures, Sandy Isaac, Nancy Juvonen and Raja Gosnell

results.title: Network
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Howard Gottfried, Paddy Chayefsky and Sidney Lumet
results.brief_description: Sidney Lumet’s “Network” is a dead-on indictment of the TV news media which seems to be growing more relevant with each passing year. Howard Beale is the long-time news anchor for the UBS-TV News. When ratings go down, Beale is fired and suffers an on-air breakdown, announcing that he is going to commit suicide on his final programme. Ironically, his angry rantings boost his ratings - much to the surprise and delight of UBS executives. Subsequently, Beale is re-hired and re-invented as the “mad prophet of the airwaves” and soon becomes a pawn of ruthless programming executives who milk his madness for every share point it’s worth. When the “prophet” ceases to be popular and profitable however, something must be done about Beale, preferably on camera, before a live audience. Cast includes: Faye Dunaway, William Holden, Peter Finch, Robert Duvall, Wesley Addy, Beatrice Straight and Ned Beatty.

results.title: Nell [DVD]
results.creator_credit: PolyGram Filmed Entertainment, Egg Pictures, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Rene Missel, Jodie Foster and Michael Apted
results.brief_description: Jodie Foster is mesmerising in her role as Nell, a woman raised in an isolated wilderness. When her mother dies, Nell is forced to face a whole new world of discovery, fear and people who want to strip her of her once protected innocence. Her precarious journey into modern society is carefully monitored by Dr. Jerome Lovell (Liam Neeson) and psychologist, Paula Olson (Natasha Richardson), who are moved by Nell’s special untouched spirit and purity. Cast also includes Richard Libertini, Nick Searcy, Jeremy Davies and O’Neal Compton. Based on the play “Idioglossia” by Mark Handley.

results.title: Ned Kelly [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Woodfall Film Productions, Neil Hartley and Tony Richardson
results.brief_description: Ned Kelly, an impoverished Irish Catholic, is driven to crime by the persecution of the English Protestant establishment and their agents, a corrupt police force. The powerful figures - judge, police chief, landowner - are presented as virtual caricatures. The film takes a folkloric approach in emphasising the general at the expense of the particular in portraying Ned’s grim existence. There is something of a mixture of styles. The setting is carefully established but the camerawork is lyrical rather than observational. At times (as in the white bull sequence) the film seems to approach abstraction while at others the mood borders on that of musical, even pseudo-Restoration comedy. Mick Jagger is subdued in the role of Ned to the point of subverting the legend. Music by Shel Silverstein. Cast also includes Allen Bickford, Geoff Gilmour, Mark McManus, Serge Lazareff, Peter Sumner, Ken Shorter, Diane Craig.

results.title: Nausicaa of the valley of the wind = Kaze no Tani no Naushika
results.creator_credit: Studio Ghibli, Tokuma Shoten, Top Craft, Isao Takahata and Hayao Miyazaki
results.brief_description: Ecologically themed anime from famed Japanese director Hayao Miyazaki set in a post apocalyptic world whereby the air is poisoned and insects engage humans in fierce battles. Princess Nausicaa, the fearless leader of her imperilled tribe, is sympathetic to the insects that others fear and loathe, and understands that she must treat them with respect in order to achieve peace. Typically outstanding animation underscores a sensitive and earnest screenplay that, unusually for its time, steers away from the distinctive violence of anime and sets the tone for subsequent Ghibli studio works.

results.title: National Velvet (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Pandro S. Berman and Clarence Brown
results.brief_description: Based on the novel “National Velvet” by Enid Bagnold, this is the incredible story of a girl who rides to victory in the celebrated Grand National at Aintree, England. Velvet Brown, a young girl passionately interested in horses wins a horse in a raffle and with the help of Mi, an ex-jockey, sets out to win the greatest steeplechase in the world, the Grand National. Stars Elizabeth Taylor and Mickey Rooney. Rated: G

results.title: Napoleon (1994) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Herald Ace, Film Australia, Michael Bourchier and Mario Andreacchio
results.brief_description: This live action Australian adventure follows an adorable pup on a cross-country search for the dingoes who comprise his doggy roots. Though the cocky young puppy’s real name is Muffin, he prefers to think of himself as Napoleon, a conquering warrior. Napoleon gets more than he bargained for when he is carried aloft in a makeshift air balloon into unknown territory. Embarking on a journey that will turn any pup into a warrior, he dares to go where no pup has gone before; discovering unknown lands and meeting some real friends along the way. [VHS 309191]

results.title: Mystic river
results.creator_credit: Malpaso Company, Robert Lorenz, Judie G. Hoyt and Clint Eastwood
results.brief_description: An intense drama from director Clint Eastwood, about three childhood friends whose paths meet in adult life when one of their teenage children is murdered. Sean Penn (Jimmy) plays the anguished father of the murdered girl (winning an Academy Award for Best Actor for his performance), with Kevin Bacon (Sean) as the police detective investigating, and Tim Robbins as the troubled suspect Dave (also an Academy Award winning performance). Based on the novel by Dennis Lehane. Cast also includes Marcia Gay Harden, Laurence Fishburne and Laura Linney.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Malpaso Company, Robert Lorenz, Judie G. Hoyt and Clint Eastwood

results.title: Mystic pizza
results.creator_credit: Samuel Goldwyn Company, Mark Levinson, Scott Rosenfelt and Donald Petrie
results.brief_description: Friends Kat, Daisy and Jojo share their insecurities, dreams and aspirations as they work at Mystic Pizza, a successful pizzeria in small town Mystic. Kat (Annabeth Gish) is sensible and intelligent, holding down 4 part time jobs to finance her way through next year’s astronomy course and about to become involved with a married man. Daisy (Julia Roberts in her first major screen role), Kat’s sister, is promiscuous and sexy, arguing with her mother who wants her to “calm down” and involved with rich kid Charlie in a possible rags to riches romance. Jojo (Lili Taylor) is engaged to fishmonger Bill but is suffering from pre-wedding jitters and her healthy libido is at odds with Bill’s catholic conscience. All three of them want to make something of their lives - perhaps get out of Mystic, and all three of them are determined to remain friends forever. Cast also includes William R Moses, Vincent D’Onofrio, Adam Storke and Conchata Ferrell.
